utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sheldon Cooper’s descent into madness, day two. It’s 2:25 a.m., and I feel the urge to urinate. My normal urination time is 7:10 a.m., but here I am, in the middle of the night, struggling to keep my mind sharp and my pajamas dry. It’s only a matter of time before my tenuous grasp on reality fades. I suppose I should pee while I still know what a toilet is.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Since when do you hum songs?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You were just humming.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you sure? Sometimes when my brain really gets moving, it makes noise.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How does your brain feel about calculating the surface tension of the domain walls?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Let’s see. Hey, I was humming. One point for Hufflepuff. What song is that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, hum it again. Is that the SpongeBob song?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (singing)
utterance.content: Who lives in a pineapple. Nope.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Whatever. Can we just get back to this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I feel like I know what song that is, but I can’t put my finger on it. My country, ’tis of thee. No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s just an earworm. It’ll come to you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. R-E-S-P-E-C-T. No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is this what we’re doing the rest of the night?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (singing)
utterance.content: I’m surprised you have to ask.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (on phone)
utterance.content: Hello, yes, I was hoping you could help me. What song is this? La, la, la, la, la, la, la. You don’t know? Well, how dare you call yourselves a Rock and Roll Hall of Fame? My goodness. Do you sing along to the greatest hits of Elvis Presley with that mouth? Well, they were no help at all.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Which is crazy, since rock and roll is all about good customer service.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. So you have a song stuck in your head. It happens to everybody.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’m not everybody. I have an eidetic memory. I should be able to remember what song this is, but I can’t. Something’s wrong with me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I told you if we were patient, he’d figure it out for himself.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was always afraid this day would come. This might be the first step of my descent into madness, where I gradually test the limits of public nudity.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Public nudity?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Eh, that just means going barefoot.

utterance.speaker: Dave (voice on phone)
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi, Dave. Uh, it’s Amy.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: Oh. How are you?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m fine. How are you?

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: Terrific. And pleasantly surprised to hear from you, given how I acted on our last date.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah, well, we both made mistakes, you know. I took the last breadstick, you gushed over my ex-boyfriend like he was Leonard Nimoy and you were my ex-boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: So, to what do I owe the pleasure?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I was wondering if you’d like to get dinner again sometime.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: Yes, please.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: Let me just check my schedule, he said, trying to seem like a man with things on his schedule.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How ’bout Saturday?

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: Uh, hmm, let me see. Uh, Friday, farmers’ market with Jay Z. Sunday, piano shopping with Elton John. Saturday works.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh. Did you know, at the United Nations, there’s a Department for Outer Space Affairs?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really? Why?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: They exist in case we ever make contact with an alien civilization.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Mm, boy, that’s one of those jobs that’s boring, boring, boring, then, oh, God, where’s the memo with what we do now?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, this is cool. So, a few weeks ago I set up a fan page on Facebook for our band and…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wait a second. How could you do that without consulting me?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s not a big deal. It just took, like, five minutes to set up.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s not the point. When we created Footprints on the Moon, we agreed that every band decision would be mutual. Now you’re just trying to take over the whole thing. You know, maybe I should go solo.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But someone joined our page. We have an actual fan.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right. This thing’s bigger than you and me, band’s back together.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, listen to what he wrote. Uh, I saw you play at the comic book store. You guys rock. And then there’s an animated smiley face raising the roof like this.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We did raise the roof that night.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, we totally did.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why do rock stars do drugs when this feels so great?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (singing)
utterance.content: Why can’t I recall this song? This is taking far too long. The urge to bang my head against the wall again and again and again and again and again is strong.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Put on some headphones.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (singing)
utterance.content: No they make my earlobes sweat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, sweetie, why don’t you take a break and do something else for a while?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There was a project I’ve been thinking about starting.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, great. What is it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll show you. Dear Crazy Future Sheldon, you were driven mad by an earworm. Your mind, once your most trusted asset, is now a sack of parrots and monkeys. So, I’m going to tell you everything you need to know. Uh, first, music is dangerous. The movie Footloose tried to warn us, but we wouldn’t listen. Oh, wait. Everyody cut footloose. Nope.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’ll pay a thousand dollars to watch you cut footloose.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is Penny. She is your friend. If she offers you food, it’s safe to take it. You probably paid for it, anyway.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, you’re really going out with Dave again?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why not? He’s actually a very nice guy.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: But he spent an entire date talking about how much he loves Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s nothing Sheldon hasn’t done before. Dave’s just a big fan of his work. Besides, he said he wouldn’t bring it up again.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay. So where’s he taking you?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, he’s coming here. I’m actually making dinner.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh. That’s a big step.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It is?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah. You’re inviting him into your home. It’s intimate. It’s where your underpants live.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know what? Good. I tried to get back together with Sheldon, he shot me down. Dave likes me. Maybe intimate is what I need.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You sure? You’ve never really been with a man. Do you really want to start with one that’s six-foot-seven?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: ‘Cause it’s like taking your driver’s test in a bus.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe we should post a comment back to our fan and thank him.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What should we write?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How about, uh, oh, how about, we might be Footprints on the Moon, but your kind words sent us over the moon.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Someday you’re gonna make an amazing grandma.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well what do you want to write?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Something badass, you know, like, thanks for diggin’ our vibe. We’ll keep rockin’ if you keep rollin’.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude, if I was wearing a bra, I’d throw it at your head right now.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll keep rockin’. You don’t do that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay. I posted it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, who is this guy?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Let’s see. Uh, his name is Trent Monaco.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Cool name.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah. He’s 24. He’s a deejay. He brews his own beer. He’s got awesome tattoos. Dude, he’s got a hot girlfriend, too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Damn. I don’t know if he’s our biggest fan or I’m his. Hey, Trent just liked our comment.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He is so cool. Hey, no hard feelings, but I’m throwing my hypothetical bra at him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God, he won’t stop.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How does he keep coming up with new ways to be annoying?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nobody knows. That’s why he’s number one. Can you please go talk to him?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on. I take care of him all day long. You do it for once.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Once? Who got the gum out of his hair?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you want, a medal? It was your gum.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Who cares?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: What are you doing in my room? Stop it. That’s mine. Why are you so strong?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Problem solved.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, he got a tuba.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dear Crazy Future Sheldon, this is a thermostat. It controls the temperature of the apartment. The ideal setting is 72 degrees. If you find this too cold, then put on a jacket. A straitjacket, ’cause 72’s the best and you’re crazy. Now, this is your spot. You’re very protective of it. When anyone else tries to sit here, you berate them relentlessly. It sounds mean, but somehow you make it adorable. People are also delighted by your love of pranks. For example, Leonard has no idea what I did to his coffee. It wasn’t replace it with Folger’s crystals, I’ll tell you that much.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, can we please get back to work?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is Leonard. He’s your best friend in the world.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, just stop. This is ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sometimes he gets cranky, but you can trust him with your life. And he does more things for you than I can even begin to list.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no, he’s drinking it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look at this. Trent is rebuilding a vintage motorcycle.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That is so cool. Old broken things are so much better than new things that work.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Who’s Trent?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, he’s our fan.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Fan of what?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Uh, did you forget? We’re in a band.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You mean because you played one time in the comic book store?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And at the children’s hospital until they asked us to leave.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, dude, Trent just checked in at the coffee shop on Fair Oaks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really? You want to go down there and meet him?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are you stalking him? That’s creepy.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s not creepy. I built a Footprints on the Moon fan page, Trent joined it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: After that, all I did was check out his profile, go back in the archive of his feed until I found his Twitter handle.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: From there, it was easy to find him on Instagram, Snapchat and pretty much track his every movement.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So if you think that’s creepy, you married the wrong guy.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Maybe I should marry Trent.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, like she could get Trent.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: This is delicious.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: Been a long time since I had a home-cooked meal.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: When you were married, did your wife cook?

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: Not at first, no. But when she began cheating on me with a French chef, she became quite the wiz in the kitchen.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, a little silver lining.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: I suppose. Yeah. Nothing takes the sting out of a shattered life like a properly-seasoned bowl of onion soup. How long have you, uh, lived here?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Uh, about five years. I’m actually thinking of moving to a better place now that I don’t need to be so close to, well, you know.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: I do. The brilliant physicist that I now know lives in the area, not that I care.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah. Anyway, he doesn’t drive, so, I pretty much had to take him everywhere.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: Had to or got to? Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: My fault. I brought him up.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: Yeah. Well, let’s change the subject. No more mentions of you-know-who. That’s a cool train. Where did you get that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bah, bam, bum-bum, bah, bum, bum. This song is never going to stop. Have you ever dealt with something so relentlessly irritating?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s a trick question, right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I shouldn’t be surprised. There’s a rich history of brilliant minds descending into madness.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, Sheldon. There are plenty of smart people who don’t have mental problems.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yup, she’s right. For every Newton who had a psychological issue, there’s an Edison who was just a jerk. That could totally be you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Empedocles thought he was a god and jumped into a volcano. And Pythagoras had an irrational fear of beans. Tesla fell madly in love with a pigeon who he claimed loved him back.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Maybe he just had bread in his pocket.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The list extends outside of science. Painters like Van Gogh and Pollock, chess champion Bobby Fischer, Brian Wilson of the Beach Boys. I remember the song. It’s called Darlin’ by the Beach Boys. Oh, thank goodness. I’m not crazy. I don’t have to take a pigeon as my bride.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There goes our shot at him living on the roof.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, all right, there he is. So, should we introduce ourselves?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. Let him spot us.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I wonder if he’s listening to our music right now.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Could you imagine? What a cool way for us to meet. He’s playing our song and looks up, and there we are, his favorite two-piece acoustic sci-fi novelty rock band.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And he’s, all, like, aren’t you the guys from Footprints on the Moo-oo-ooh what is he doing?!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I can’t watch.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s okay. Oh, it’s okay. He’s done.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why is he looking at it?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Eh, no, he’s not going to eat it, is he?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Come on, Trent, you’re better than th-ah.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let’s just go.

utterance.speaker: Trent
utterance.content: Hey, aren’t you the guys?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, never heard of ’em!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I wonder why it was this particular song that was stuck in my head.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. It’s pretty catchy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Do you even like the Beach Boys?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They have beach right in the name. What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, now that you can focus again, what do you say we get back to surface tension of domain walls?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course. I’m already seeing a more efficient way of taming the ultravi… I know why the song was in my head.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s about Amy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, look, I know Amy’s like an old lady, but she’s not old enough to have a song from the sixties written about her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s about how she made my life better. Consider the lyrics. I was living like half a man. Then I couldn’t love, but now I can. More soul than I ever had. I love the way you soften my life.”

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: She did soften your life, didn’t she?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. She’s like the dryer sheets of my heart. I have to go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Aw. Am I like the dryer sheets of your heart?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Better. You’re the lint trap of my love.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Aw.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s an interesting tie clip.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: Oh, thanks. It’s, uh, Avogadro’s constant. It’s useful for calculating the number of atoms in a substance, or causing regret in anyone who asks about it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, I, I think it’s neat. Oh.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: Sorry. Sorry. No one’s ever liked the tie clip before, so I just lost all control.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, it, it’s okay, and we are on a date. I’m, I’m just a little nervous.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: Well, no need to be nervous with me. I’m just a harmless giant from a foreign land.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, I’m just being silly. I, I don’t know what I’m waiting for.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy? Amy? Amy?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: You’re kidding. How’s my hair?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, this, this isn’t a good time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t care. Amy, there was a song I couldn’t get out of my head. Eventually, I realized the song was about you, and like that earworm, I can’t get you out of my heart. So, what I’m trying to say is, you’re my heartworm. The metaphorical kind, not, not the poodle-killing kind.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: If I may, I believe what he’s saying, in a charming and delightful way, is that he loves you and wants you back. Dave Gibbs, huge fan of your work. Don’t mind me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m, I’m sorry; I didn’t realize you were on a date.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, it, it, it’s okay. Keep going?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy, if you want to be my girlfriend again, I really want to be your boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I really want that, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good. Because I love you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I love you, too.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: Kiss her, you brilliant fool.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’ll let you get back to your date.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Get back here.

utterance.speaker: Dave
utterance.content: Okay, then. I’ll, uh, see myself out. Amy, thank you for dinner. Dr. Cooper, pleasure to meet you, sir. Uh, if perhaps sometime you have a spare moment, I’d, uh, love to discuss physics, or shoot the breeze, as you Yanks say. Ah. What a lovely evening.
